extractPrefix

public static java.lang.String extractPrefix(java.lang.String aQNameValue)
Extracts the prefix from a QName value. This is the value that comes before the colon in a qname. i.e. foo:x, this method returns 'foo'

Parameters:
aQNameValue - can be null
Returns:
String or null if there is no prefix or the param is null

extractLocalPart

public static java.lang.String extractLocalPart(java.lang.String aQNameValue)
Extracts the localname from a QName value. This is the value that comes after the colon in a qname. i.e. foo:x, this method returns 'x'

Parameters:
aQNameValue - can be null
Returns:
String or null the input is null or aQNameValue if there is no colon.

copyNodeContents

public static void copyNodeContents(org.w3c.dom.Node aSource,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Node aTarget)
Copies the contents beneath a source node and makes them children of the target node. Any attributes of the source root will be moved to the target node as well. The one unsafe situation in regard to namespace prefix remapping is if we've remapped a prefix and the target element has attributes that may contain embedded qname strings or other content that depends on a specific prefix mapping

Parameters:
aSource - the source of the copy operation
aTarget - the target of the copy operation

Walks the element's ancestors looking for the prefix in use for the given namespace declaration.

Parameters:
aElement - the element context to find the namespace in
aNamespace - the namespace we ant the prefix for
aAllowDefault - true if we allow default namespaces to be returned
Returns:
String the prefix, which is the prefix or an empty string if default namespace, or null if not found

getPrefixForNamespace

public static java.lang.String getPrefixForNamespace(org.w3c.dom.Element aElement,
                                                     java.lang.String aNamespace)
Walks the element's ancestors looking for the prefix in use for the given namespace declaration. Note this calls assumes that you will allow default namespaces to be returned (empty prefix - "").

Parameters:
aElement - the element context to find the namespace in
aNamespace - the namespace we ant the prefix for
Returns:
String the prefix, which is the prefix or an empty string if default namespace, or null if not found

getXSIType

public static javax.xml.namespace.QName getXSIType(org.w3c.dom.Element aElem)
Given an XML element, returns the element's schema type. It does this by first checking for an attribute of "xsi:type". If this is found then that value is used. If no such attribute is found, then returns null.

Parameters:
aElem -

aElem -

aPreferredPrefix -

isValidNCName

public static boolean isValidNCName(java.lang.String aName)
Utility method to determine if the give String is a valid XML NCName. For a name to be a valid NCName it must begin with a letter or underscore character, followed by zero or more letters, digits, ".", "-" or "_" characters. This method returns true if the argument name is a valid NCName, otherwise it returns false.

Parameters:
aName - the name to be checked.
Returns:
returns true if name is a valid NCName, otherwise returns false.

getOrCreatePrefix

getOrCreatePrefix

public static java.lang.String getOrCreatePrefix(org.w3c.dom.Element aParentElement,
                                                 java.lang.String aNamespace,
                                                 java.lang.String aPreferredPrefix,
                                                 boolean aDeclareRootFlag,
                                                 boolean aAllowDefaultNS)
Gets the prefix to use for the given namespace. If none is found, then a unique prefix is added to the element.

Parameters:
aParentElement - - element to begin search for prefix.
aNamespace - - value of the ns that you're searching for
aPreferredPrefix - - preferred value to use for the prefix
aDeclareRootFlag - - if true a newly created prefix is defined on the root element
aAllowDefaultNS - - if true then we'll consider a default ns
Returns:
existing prefix, or newly created one, or empty string if default ns is in scope

findDefaultNamespace

public static java.lang.String findDefaultNamespace(org.w3c.dom.Element aElement)
Returns the default namespace that is currently in-scope for the given Element. This method will walk up the DOM hierarchy looking for xmlns declarations.

Parameters:
aElement -

removeDuplicateNSDecls

public static void removeDuplicateNSDecls(org.w3c.dom.Element aElement)
Removes unnecessary namespace declarations from the given Element. This is accomplished by iterating over the xmlns:prefix attributes in the Element and removing any declaration that already exists somewhere in the parent hierarchy. In other words, walk up the DOM hierarchy looking for declarations of the same prefix to the same namespace.

Parameters:
aElement -
